thread.title: Rampage rally for first win of season
thread.title_full: Rampage rally for first win of season - San Antonio Express-News

author: mysanantonio.com
title: Rampage rally for first win of season
text:
Rampage 3, Grand Rapids 2
GRAND RAPIDS, Mich. — The Rampage grabbed their first win of the season against the Griffins on Friday in front of 10,834 at Van Andel Arena.
Andrew Agozzino scored two goals, and Zach Redmond notched the game-winner in the third period.
Trailing 2-1 after two periods, the Rampage (1-0-1-0) capitalized on a 5-on-3 advantage. Agozzino’s tip-in goal just 50 seconds in to the third period tied the game, and Redmond finished the scoring at 14:51 with a power play goal of his own.
Rampage goaltender Calvin Pickard made 39 saves against Grand Rapids, which outshot S.A. 41-29.
Agozzino got the Rampage off to a quick start, scoring his first goal off a feed from Ben Street at 2:08 of the first period.
Notes: The Rampage and Griffins combined for 15 minor penalties totaling 30 minutes. Of the five goals scored in the game, four came on power plays. S.A. finished 2 for 7 with the advantage while holding Grand Rapids to two goals on eight opportunities.
Next: Rampage @Grand Rapids, 6 p.m.
Radio: KTKR-AM 760
Staff report
